text: got it not a great day for the pheasants
but pretty good flying by Shenton that's
the name of the goshawk who's wearing a
camera during this chase
those quick jumps that's shinta moving
her head
researchers at Haverford College
analyzed these videos of shinta 'z
flights to learn more about how gas hogs
hunt they see so well and react so fast
that their flight through a thicket
could make a fighter pilot queasy but
what's their strategy classical pursuit
a straight chase or come in at an angle
cut it off at the pass
turns out the goshawk combine the two
and that was a surprise first its
classical pursuit then when the prey
veers away that birds play the angle and
then just before the kill they switch
back to straight pursuit it's deadly
when it works but most of the time as
good as the Hawks are prey gets away
